An array of
objects you can use to create a ComponentLink, allowing a link to anywhere in News.
You can add a link to a
component to make the entire component tappable. Any links used in its child components are not interactable.
A Boolean value that allows the placement of ad banners between components. Nested components inherit the value of the outermost container that explicitly sets
. The default value is
An object that defines vertical alignment with another component.
An object that defines an animation you apply to the component.

value for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
An object that defines behavior for a component, like

The
value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
An array of components to display as child components. Child components are positioned and rendered relative to their parent component.
An instance or array of container properties that can be applied conditionally, and the conditions that cause Apple News Forrmat to apply them.
An object that defines how to position child components within this
component. A
, for example, allows for displaying child components side by side.
In versions of News prior to iOS 11, child components are positioned as if
were not defined.
The
value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
A Boolean value that determines whether the component is hidden.
An optional unique identifier for this component. If used, this
must be unique across the entire document. You will need an
for your component if you want to anchor other components to it.
An inline
object that contains layout information, or a string reference to a
object that is defined at the top level of the document.
If
is not defined, size and position are based on various factors, such as the device type, the length of the content, and the
of this component.
An inline
object that defines the appearance of this component, or a string reference to a
object that is defined at the top level of the document.
The
value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
A

component is a structural component that holds other components and allows for logical grouping to use for layout and styling information. Child components of container are positioned and rendered relative to the parent component. The minimum size of a container component is determined by the size of its child components.

abstract.text: Learn the basic Apple News Format container concepts required for the three advanced tutorials.
Add a scene to your article to create special effects.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Adding a Scene to a Chapter or a Section Header

abstract.text: Learn the basics for adding components to your article.
Link to an article by using the article-linking container component.
Configure a side-by-side, horizontal arrangement of components for your article.
Use container components to create the component hierarchies you need for special article designs.
Get Apple News Format reference information, and create signature content for Apple News.
The object for anchoring one component to another component in your article’s layout.
The container component for creating a link to an article.
The component for setting apart content that is not directly related to the article, such as promotional content.
Properties shared by all the behaviors you can use to affect how components react to device motion and scrolling.
The component for organizing an article into chapters.
An object used in any container component type to define how the collection of child components is presented.
Properties shared by all component types.
Properties that all types of animations share.
The object for defining the positioning for a specific component within the article’s column system.
The component addition object for making a component interactive and opening a link to another location in News.
The object for setting style properties for components, including background color and fill, borders, and table styles.
The object for defining conditional properties for a container component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
Properties shared by all container types.
The component for defining a horizontal line to visually divide parts of your article.
The component for redistributing empty space inside a horizontal stack collection.
The component for defining the top area of an article, chapter, or section.
The object for displaying components side by side in a Container component.
The behavior whereby a component moves at a speed different from the scroll speed.
The identifier provided by the publisher.
The component for organizing an article into sections.
The behavior whereby a component acts as if it’s on a short spring.
The patterns supported for article identifiers in UUID format.
